noun.description: A line or ridge produced on paper or cloth by folding, pressing, or crushing.
Any of a number of lines marked on the pitch at specified places, especially the position of a batsman.
An area around the goal in ice hockey or lacrosse that attacking players may not normally enter unless the puck or ball has already done so.

verb.description: Make a crease in (cloth or paper)
examples: he sank into the chair, careful not to crease his dinner jacket

verb.description: (of a bullet) graze (someone or something), causing little damage.

origin: Late 16th century: probably a variant of crest.
